metadata.synopsis: A 1920s Latin American colonel wants a bootlegger, an Irishman and an ex-priest (Robert Mitchum) to kill a godless tyrant (Frank Langella).

reviews: Is easy enough to enjoy because it seldom takes itself very seriously.
Nelson, who also wrote the script, isn't consistent in the kind of movie he has made. Are these three devil-may-care soldiers of fortune types? Is the movie about total evil?
It slowly builds to an action-packed conclusion that saves it from the doldrums.
